div.p: RATIBOR a town of Germany, in Sileſia, and capital of a duchy of the ſame name, with a caſtle. It has been twice taken by the Swedes, and is ſeated on the river oder, in a country fertile in corn and fruits, 15 miles north-eaſt of Troppaw, and 142 eaſt of Prague. E. Long. 22. 24. N. Lat. 50. 14.
